On the question of the date of his departure from Deventer Erasmus himself throws some light in an 91191ν91·ω sent to a correspondent who claimed to have been his contemporary in the school: ‘eum ego Dauentria discederem, nondum fluuius qui vrbem praeterfluit ponte iunctus erat.’ To illustrate this Revius¹¹ quotes a manuscript to show that the bridge was begun on 1 Aug. 1482 and opened to traffic on 16 March 14833 and thus there is 911 obvious contradiction to the date given above.
